mandatory_inclusions: Legal recognition and security of electronic records and digital signatures.
Compliance with data integrity and preventing unauthorized access to computer systems.
Adherence to regulations regarding the creation and use of digital certificates.
Prohibitions against computer-related crimes (hacking, source code alteration, and data theft).
Mandatory consent for collecting and processing personal data of users or employees.
Implementation of technical measures (encryption, access controls) to protect personal information.
Strict protocols for cross-border data transfer and data subject rights.
Confidentiality of sensitive personal data including health and financial records.

mandatory_inclusions: Mandatory incorporation as a public limited company.
Strict corporate governance and fiduciary duties of Directors as per NRB standards.
Compliance with capital adequacy ratios and statutory reserve requirements.
Maintenance of banking secrecy and protection of depositor rights.
Compliance with Anti-Money Laundering (AML) and Combating the Financing of Terrorism (CFT) reporting.
Submission of monthly/quarterly financial stability reports to the Central Bank.
Adherence to Know Your Customer (KYC) norms and risk management frameworks.
Affiliation with the Social Welfare Council (SWC) to receive foreign funding.
Requirement for INGOs to enter into General and Project Agreements with the SWC.
Submission of annual progress reports and audited financial statements to the SWC.
Limit on administrative expenses (usually capped at 20% of the total project budget).
Annual renewal of registration at the District Administration Office (DAO).
Mandatory submission of the organization's constitution and list of executive committee members.
Prohibition of engaging in political activities or profit-making unrelated to objectives.

mandatory_inclusions: Obligation to provide 24-hour emergency services and basic health services to citizens.
Obtaining informed consent from patients before medical procedures.
Compliance with the Health Institution Operation Standards regarding infrastructure and equipment.
Proper management and disposal of biomedical waste as per environmental norms.
Verification that all practicing physicians have valid NMC registration.
Adherence to the Professional Code of Conduct for medical practitioners.
Mandatory reporting of notifiable diseases to government authorities.
Compliance with national curriculum standards and standardized examination procedures.
Regulation of tuition fees and approval of fee structures by local authorities.
Prohibition of physical or psychological punishment of students.
Provision of mandatory scholarships (usually 10%) for marginalized or deserving students.
Ensuring the right to free and compulsory basic education (grades 1-8).
Prohibition of enrollment fees for basic education in government-funded or regulated tracks.
Mandatory school enrollment for children within the specified age group.
